page.title: 09MALBOROUGH CHURCH
page.content: The earliest part of{Malborough Church was built in about{1200 A.D.}The first known vicar was{Sir Thomas De {Kentesbyry.}He was vicar from {1309-10.}When the roof of the church was renewed in{1959}an old style {Batten Gauge}was found where workman had left it in{1850}when it was last renewed.Also they found an old small piece of{lead guttering}cut from the vestry roof dated{1678.}The biggest monument in the church is in the north aisle.It's in memory of{John Stapleton {De Courcy}who died on the 7th January 1847 aged 42.In 1979 during strong gales the{weather cock}fell off the top of the church.The school held a {sponsored spell}to raise money to have it put back on.
